snippet.textDisplay: I downloaded this song the day you uploaded it, and I've listened to it more than 100 times since then. Every time it came up on my playlist, I felt a sensation. I couldn't quite explain what it was then, but I can now.    Here you go: When I listen to it, I feel like in the middle of a huge mystery I can't solve. I've been trying day in and day to solve this mystery, but I haven't gotten very far, and with every step I take, it gets more and more complicated. But I'm letting all that go now. It's not going away, but I've stopped obsessing after it and let my mind wander into the beautiful natural landscape around me. My senses are heightened, and I get lost in the moment. The wind whips through my hair. The waves wash up on shore. I grow stronger with every passing moment. My strength returns to me. I don't know what lies ahead, but I'm excited for what lies ahead, and more importantly, I'm prepared to face it. But I won't face it today. Today, I'll lie back and take in the beauty of life.     In terms of the game it was written for, this is a fitting piece, and it the a perfect one to play on the main menu screen. I love it.

snippet.textDisplay: I have to say, this game has such a style to it that Telltale kind of lost by constantly repeating the same game mechanics. Life is Strange has a real coming of age teen movie to it which in most cases, I would completely ignore but the presentation in terms of music and art and just the twists that the game is presenting us with, puts this game far above most games I've played in a while, despite it's obvious setbacks in terms of writing and dialogue.
snippet.textOriginal: I have to say, this game has such a style to it that Telltale kind of lost by constantly repeating the same game mechanics. Life is Strange has a real coming of age teen movie to it which in most cases, I would completely ignore but the presentation in terms of music and art and just the twists that the game is presenting us with, puts this game far above most games I've played in a while, despite it's obvious setbacks in terms of writing and dialogue.

snippet.textDisplay: Omg I love this game so much great indie music wonderful story it's not only for teenagers the story is really mind-blowing and the characters are really deep I mean they aren't just some protagonist this game is full of good ideas can't wait for Ep. 4 :)

snippet.textDisplay: I picked this up this past week on the summer sale.  I've only played the first episode so far, but I enjoyed it quite a bit.  It's comfy and charming, and while it's definitely meant to appeal to teens, it's still enjoyable.
snippet.textOriginal: I picked this up this past week on the summer sale.  I've only played the first episode so far, but I enjoyed it quite a bit.  It's comfy and charming, and while it's definitely meant to appeal to teens, it's still enjoyable.

snippet.textDisplay: One of my GOTY contenders this year, I hope the rest of the episodes come out well enough to confirm that.
snippet.textOriginal: One of my GOTY contenders this year, I hope the rest of the episodes come out well enough to confirm that.

snippet.textDisplay: Despite the cringworhty dialogues,wich I don't see it, maybe it's because english isn't my native language, this game was a pleasent surprise. So far I liked what I played, and the exploration you can do is huge. I mean, there is a lot of things you can miss if you don't explore and a lot of little things you can learn just for snooping.

snippet.textDisplay: There's been a big surge of episodic games since Walking Dead's success. This is the one that I'm most interested in playing, and I definitely will this year. I've heard great things about it and I really enjoyed some of the tracks I listened to. This main menu theme is super peaceful.
